title: Execution failed block=17034872
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
```
erigon version 2.42.0-stable-beb97784
```

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
```
Linux eth1 5.15.0-57-generic #63-Ubuntu SMP Thu Nov 24 13:43:17 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
Commit hash: 
```
commit beb97784d43ece5acde365a74efe8763692ebdba (HEAD, tag: v2.42.0)
```

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
```
exec erigon --snapshots=true --datadir=/erigon/data/eth --torrent.download.slots=3 --torrent.download.rate=10mb --nat extip:<REMOVED IP> --http --http.addr="0.0.0.0" --http.port="8545" --http.compression --ws --ws.compression --metrics --metrics.addr=0.0.0.0 --metrics.port=6060 --pprof --pprof.addr=0.0.0.0 --pprof.port=6061 --healthcheck --authrpc.jwtsecret=/erigon/data/eth/jwt.hex --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9090 --externalcl
```

Concensus Layer:
```
Lighthouse v4.0.0-0616e01
BLS library: blst
SHA256 hardware acceleration: true
Allocator: jemalloc
Specs: mainnet (true), minimal (false), gnosis (false)
```

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):
```
exec lighthouse --network mainnet beacon --datadir=/lighthouse/data/mainnet --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --execution-jwt /erigon/data/eth/jwt.hex  --checkpoint-sync-url https://beaconstate.ethstaker.cc --http --http-address 0.0.0.0
```

Chain/Network: 
```
Mainnet (chainId 1)
```

After I get to block 17034872 it fails to execute and unwinds. Once it's caught back up it fails again and unwinds causing a never-ending cycle.
```
[INFO] [04-14|21:51:06.179] [5/15 Bodies] Downloading block bodies block_num=17044495 delivery/sec=12.4MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=3617 delivered=27953 cache=255.8MB alloc=3.0GB sys=8.3GB

```

I'm also facing the same problem at block 17034872 

```
Apr 15 22:37:52 erigon erigon[116463]: [INFO] [04-15|22:37:52.982] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=0

same problem on block=17034870

```
Apr 17 04:18:02 eth-fullnode erigon[701]: [INFO] [04-17|04:18:02.740] [txpool] stat                            block=14999999 pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.6GB sys=5.5GB
Apr 17 04:18:31 eth-fullnode erigon[701]: [WARN] [04-17|04:18:31.523] Served                                   conn=45.118.135.196:46664 method=eth_accounts reqid=1 t=39.82µs err="the method has been deprecated: eth_accounts"
Apr 17 04:18:55 eth-fullnode erigon[701]: [WARN] [04-17|04:18:55.564] Served                                   conn=139.162.8.59:36822 method=eth_accounts reqid=0 t=39.48µs err="the method has been deprecated: eth_accounts"

Apr 17 04:20:02 eth-fullnode erigon[701]: [INFO] [04-17|04:20:02.729] [LightClient] P2P                        peers=9
Apr 17 04:20:02 eth-fullnode erigon[701]: [INFO] [04-17|04:20:02.741] [txpool] stat                            block=14999999 pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=4.3GB sys=5.5GB

@lbadger it looks like your CL is too far ahead of Erigon, causing an infinite loop. This has been reported in #7260, the workaround is to stop the CL, let Erigon catch up, and then reconnect them, which is painful. It is noted that in #7260 the bug has been fixed in devel, but I have not verified it myself.

@achiko  and @toan-superman your logs show a different problem to the one posted by @lbadger, more likely related to #7077.

> @lbadger it looks like your CL is too far ahead of Erigon, causing an infinite loop. This has been reported in #7260, the workaround is to stop the CL, let Erigon catch up, and then reconnect them, which is painful. It is noted that in #7260 the bug has been fixed in devel, but I have not verified it myself.
> 
> @achiko and @toan-superman your logs show a different problem to the one posted by @lbadger, more likely related to #7077.

I think I unintentionally did this and appears to be working. It's still syncing, but it looks like I finally got past that block. Thank you!
